Package lt.galdebar.monmon.categoriesparser.services

Class ExcelParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • lt.galdebar.monmon.categoriesparser.services.ExcelParser
  • public class ExcelParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses the supplied Excel file into a list of CategoryDTO objects.
    Also adds "Uncategorized" Whilst parsing splits the "Food,Beverages & Tobacco" category into three separate categories. Also expands Food Items with subcategories, because the aim of the app is everyday shopping. Sheet name "Food,Beverages & Tobacco" category name and names of categories to split it into are provided as private static final String fields.

      • isParserValid

        public boolean isParserValid()
        Checks if the parser is valid. Method should be called before executing the parser, otherwise will throw IOException.
        Returns:
        the boolean

      • getCategories

        public java.util.List<CategoryDTO> getCategories()
        Main Excel Parser method. Calls all other methods to generate CategoryDTO list.
        Returns:
        the categories

      • getUnfilteredCategories

        java.util.List<CategoryDTO> getUnfilteredCategories()
        First parsing step. Simply reads the sheet into an unfiltered, unparsed list of CategoryDTO objects.
        Returns:
        the unfiltered categories

      • generateDTOFromRow

        CategoryDTO generateDTOFromRow​(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Row row)
        Reads a single Row object and produces a CategoryDTO object from it. Ignores the first column, because I don't need the category ID in Google nomenclature.
        Parameters:
        row - the row
        Returns:
        the category dto

      • addKeywordsIfValid

        void addKeywordsIfValid​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keywords,
                        java.lang.String cellValue)
        Adds the cell value to a set of category keywords if the cell value is NOT "Food Items", "Tobacco Products", "Beverages" or "Food, Beverages & Tobacco". This ensures that category names are not amongst the keywords. The category names are set as private final static String fields for the class.
        Parameters:
        keywords - the keywords
        cellValue - the cell value

      • getFoodCategoryName

        void getFoodCategoryName​(int column,
                         CategoryDTO parsedExcelRow,
                         java.lang.String cellValue)
        Sets food category name. Will onl execute if CategoryDTO subcategory is "Food Items" and the supplied cell count is 4.
        Since I've decided to split food items, tobacco products and beverages into separate categories, I had to shift where the category name is found by one column.
        Parameters:
        column - the column
        parsedExcelRow - the category dto
        cellValue - the cell value

      • getSubcategoryName

        void getSubcategoryName​(int cellCount,
                        CategoryDTO parsedExcelRow,
                        java.lang.String cellValue)
        Only sets "Food Items".
        This is neccessary because I wanted to expand the Food Items category.
        Parameters:
        cellCount - the cell count
        parsedExcelRow - the category dto
        cellValue - the cell value

      • getCategoryName

        void getCategoryName​(int column,
                     CategoryDTO parsedExcelRow,
                     java.lang.String cellValue)
        Gets category name.
        If column is 2, sets whatever cell value provided. If column is 3, checks whether it's a tobacco or beverages category and sets appropriately.
        Parameters:
        column - the column count
        parsedExcelRow - the category dto
        cellValue - the cell value

      • consolidateSimilarCategories

        java.util.List<CategoryDTO> consolidateSimilarCategories​(java.util.List<CategoryDTO> unfilteredList)
        First filtering step.
        If subcategory is "Food Items", then updates subcategory with whatever Food category was asigned. Checks unfiltered CategoryDTO objects in pairs. If object categories match, then keywords from object 2 are added to are added to object1, object1 is saved to filtered list whilst object 2 is discarded.
        Parameters:
        unfilteredList - the unfiltered list
        Returns:
        filtered list

      • removeEmptyEntries

        java.util.List<CategoryDTO> removeEmptyEntries​(java.util.List<CategoryDTO> parsedExcelRowList)
        Additional list filtering step.
        Disregards all CategoryDTO objects that
        • have empty category names
        • are uncategorized and have more than 1 keyword
        • category name is "Food, Beverages & Tobacco"
        Parameters:
        parsedExcelRowList - the category dto list
        Returns:
        the filtered
